Computer Science and Mathematics Degree

University of Bath graduate with a Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science and Mathematics.

Academic Focus

During my studies, I particularly enjoyed pure forms of mathematics in the realms of:

  • Algebra
  • Real Analysis
  • Type Theory
  • Proof Assistants

Dissertation

My dissertation focused on the Lean proof assistant language. I worked on bringing a proof from asymptotic analysis and formalising it within Lean. This project provided valuable experience with:

  • Formal mathematics
  • Programming language theory
  • Logic and semantics
  • Type systems

Image: University of Bath campus - 600x400

Achievements

  • Completed degree in Computer Science and Mathematics
  • Successfully defended dissertation on proof formalisation
  • Developed strong analytical and problem-solving skills

item.title: Language Learning
item.description:
Language Learning

I have an ongoing interest in learning foreign languages. My approach tends to focus on understanding the underlying logic and grammar of each language.

Languages Studied

French Studied French language with emphasis on grammar rules and sentence structure.

Spanish Explored Spanish vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation patterns.

Russian Engaged with the Cyrillic alphabet, Russian grammar, and basic conversational phrases.

Learning Approach

My approach to language learning is similar to my academic studies - I focus heavily on the underlying logic and grammar systems. While this provides a strong theoretical foundation, I sometimes overlook the practical application of the language in everyday conversation.

Language Learning

I have an ongoing interest in learning foreign languages. My approach tends to focus on understanding the underlying logic and grammar of each language.

Languages Studied

French Studied French language with emphasis on grammar rules and sentence structure.

Spanish Explored Spanish vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation patterns.

Russian Engaged with the Cyrillic alphabet, Russian grammar, and basic conversational phrases.

Learning Approach

My approach to language learning is similar to my academic studies - I focus heavily on the underlying logic and grammar systems. While this provides a strong theoretical foundation, I sometimes overlook the practical application of the language in everyday conversation.

Image: Language textbooks - 500x350

Future Goals

  • Improve conversational skills in studied languages
  • Practice speaking with native speakers
  • Expand vocabulary through reading and conversation
